summary: This bill, the Global Fragility Reauthorization Act, reauthorizes the Global Fragility Act of 2019. It mandates annual meetings of senior Federal officials to assess and align strategic approaches and objectives of country and regional plans with current U.S. policy priorities. It extends the authorization for the Prevention and Stabilization Fund and the Complex Crises Fund to 2030, and authorizes the use of the Economic Support Fund for monitoring, evaluation, and learning activities related to the Global Fragility Strategy.
